choices: ... refers to the reason for purchase.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What terms can be used to describe Ms. Brändli's buying motive?
elements.correctAnswer: Recognition, prestige, exclusivity, enjoyment of design objects, etc.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: You have learned about two main groups of buying motives. Which group does Mrs. Brändli's buying motive belong to?
elements.correctAnswer: This is an emotional buying motive. Reason: The extravagant design is decisive for the customer when choosing the fountain pen.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What keywords can be used to summarize Ms. Brändli's complete needs framework (purchase desire, purchase motive and need)?
elements.correctAnswer: Purchase request: fountain pen; Purchase motive: recognition, prestige, etc.; Need (the right product): Fountain pen with striking design from the upper price range
